title: American_Top_40_1985_November_9th
description:
"Every week we count down the biggest songs in the land, from Climax, Colorado, to Climax, Georgia; from Climax, Michigan, to Climax Springs, Missouri; and at number 31, here's the band called Klymaxx with their first top 40 hit, 'I Miss You'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

A listener wants to know, "What woman in chart history has had the most top 40 hits?" Casey lists the top three. They have had a combined total of 136 top 40 hits.

Casey tells how Bob Eubanks (host of the Newlywed Game and two-time guest host of AT40) once turned down the chance to manage a superstar in this countdown.

Casey tells how a 12 year-old-boy once made a live recording at a concert in 1963 which went on to hold the record as the biggest hit song ever recorded in front of an audience.

Arcadia, Kate Bush, and The Hooters have their first top 40 hits.

Casey answers the question, "In the rock era, what act has had the most consecutive top ten hits?" Casey says this superstar had 21 top ten singles in a row, but the song, "One Broken Heart For Sale" ended his streak.
